alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:54AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kay, Noble, southern Grant and northeastern Garfield Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 254 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nash to 3 miles west of Billings to 3 miles southwest of Morrison. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enid, Ponca City, Blackwell, Perry, Tonkawa, Medford, Pond Creek, Garber, Morrison, Billings, Lamont, Red Rock, Kremlin, Breckenridge, Marland, Nash, Hunter, Deer Creek, Jefferson, and Nardin. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 189 and 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
